title: Rory vs. Bryson: What to expect from an epic Sunday showdown
content: There are 18 holes between Rory McIlroy and a career Grand Slam. But Bryson DeChambeau is in the way.

title: Former LSU receiver Lacy found dead at age 24
content: Former LSU receiver Kyren Lacy was found dead Saturday night in Houston, an LSU official confirmed to ESPN.

title: Rory seizes Masters lead, but Bryson just 2 back
content: Rory McIlroy will take a two-shot lead into the final round of the Masters, with Bryson DeChambeau hot on his heels after a furious finish Saturday.

title: Blazers sign coach Billups to new multiyear deal
content: The Trail Blazers have signed coach Chauncey Billups to a multiyear contract extension after he led Portland to a 22-18 record since Jan. 19.

title: Mbappé gets straight red card for dangerous play
content: Kylian Mbappe was shown a straight red card for a dangerous challenge during the first half of Real Madrid's crucial La Liga clash with Alaves.

title: Vols, Iamaleava split; 'no one bigger' than team
content: Tennessee is moving on from starting quarterback Nico Iamaleava, with sources telling ESPN that his decision to skip Friday's practice was a tipping point.

title: Houston tourney star Uzan to declare for draft
content: Houston guard Milos Uzan, a breakout star in the men's NCAA tournament, will declare for the 2025 NBA draft.

title: Alcaraz shines on clay, claims Monte Carlo title
content: Carlos Alcaraz won his first Monte Carlo title as he played in his third straight clay-court final and gained momentum ahead of next month's French Open.

title: Masterful win: Son of ex-PGAer gets 1st MLB win
content: Tigers pitching prospect Jackson Jobe, the son of former pro golfer Brandt Jobe, earned his first major league win on Masters weekend.

title: Everything at stake on the final day of the NBA regular season
content: The East bracket is set. The West's ... is not. Meanwhile, lottery races across the league will be decided Sunday.

title: NBA postseason tracker: Eastern Conference playoffs set
content: Tracking which teams have clinched for the playoffs with the 2024-25 NBA regular season nearing its conclusion.

title: 'Bryson's in the backyard': A Masters contender comes to visit
content: Before Bryson DeChambeau shot a Saturday 69 to get himself into contention, he was putting in work on a stranger's putting green.

title: The draft's biggest risers: Seven players who have boosted their stock since last summer
content: Kyle Williams and Darien Porter are among the 2025 prospects who have improved their draft status this year.

title: Projecting WNBA draft 1st round: Bueckers still No. 1 as Malonga rises; Van Lith, Prince out
content: The No. 2 pick sees an international entry, while Hailey Van Lith and Sedona Prince drop out of the first round.

title: Ipswich's first XI vs. Chelsea cost less than Cole Palmer, but they almost won
content: Chelsea have spent billions in the transfer market, but they almost lost to an Ipswich Town side whose entire squad cost less than Enzo Fernandez.

title: Source: Utd's Onana dropped for Newcastle clash
content: André Onana has been left out of Manchester United's Premier League clash with Newcastle on Sunday, a source has told ESPN, following heavy criticism of performance against Lyon.

title: Reports: USMNT's McKennie in gambling probe
content: United States midfielder Weston McKennie is among 13 soccer players being investigated for illegal online betting in Italy, according to widespread media reports.

title: Martinelli: Nørgaard 'could have broken my leg'
content: Arsenal winger Gabriel Martinelli has said Christian Nørgaard "could have broken my leg" and should have been sent off for a late tackle in Saturday's 1-1 draw with Brentford.

title: Austin GK catches mouse on field during game
content: An unexpected visitor briefly interrupted Saturday's MLS encounter between the Vancouver Whitecaps and Austin FC, when a mouse had to be rescued from the field at BC Place.

title: Martínez tackle 'like a goal' as Barça close on title
content: Hansi Flick celebrated Iñigo Martínez's incredible stoppage-time tackle as if it was a goal as Barcelona took another step towards the LaLiga titl.

title: USMNT striker White scores 4 in Whitecaps rout
content: USMNT striker Brian White scored a franchise-record four goals and became the first player in Whitecaps history to score 50 career regular-season goals as Vancouver beat Austin FC 5-1.

title: Bayern held by Dortmund to keep title race alive
content: Borussia Dortmund prevented Bayern Munich from going eight points clear in the Bundesliga on Saturday by fighting back for a 2-2 draw in "der Klassiker."

title: Ronaldo nets stunning volley to hand Al Nassr win
content: Cristiano Ronaldo scored twice, including a stunning volleyed effort, to give Al Nassr a come-from-behind win over the visiting Al Riyadh in the Saudi Pro League on Saturday.

title: 'An ordinary guy': What's John Daly doing at the Hooters in Augusta?
content: Daly hasn't played the Masters since 2006, but every year he shows up in town to hang and sell merch.

title: Why Sedona Prince is the toughest WNBA draft prospect to evaluate
content: She's a skilled 6-7 center, but some GMs have expressed doubt about drafting Sedona Prince after accusations of intimate partner violence.

title: 'They're the ones who made me love gymnastics again': After heartbreak, Konnor McClain has found joy at LSU
content: Konnor McClain dealt with devastating loss and tough injuries, but she's back at the top of NCAA gymnastics.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eyeing move for Cherki
content: Man United are reportedly looking at a possible deal to sign Lyon's Rayan Cherki. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: CAG must audit how policies benefited private firms: Cong on fuel excise duty hike under Modi govt
content: The Congress leader said along with government companies, the private oil companies are also earning huge profits from refining and marketing, while the common man is burdened with expensive petrol and diesel.

title: Telangana, a pioneer in the implementation of landmark welfare schemes, says Bhatti
content: Fine rice is being distributed to 90 lakh families with ration cards and 2.85 crore beneficiaries across the State, the Deputy Chief Minister said

title: Muslim Personal Law Board protest meeting against waqf legislation at Darussalaam on April 19: Owaisi
content: Owaisi demands answers from PM Modi on whether Sambhal, Mathura and other Muslim would continue to be waqf

title: U.S. NSA Waltz puts off India visit amid ‘Signalgate’ controversy
content: Michael Waltz was due to visit Delhi next week. He is under fire over chats on Messaging platform Signal involving sensitive information such as military operations. He accepted the blame for inadvertently adding a senior journalist to the chat. Vice-President J.D. Vance to continue ‘private’ visit with family.

title: Differences over caste census report start cropping up in govt.
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar, the Vokkaliga leader, says it is his duty to get justice for all communities

title: Government to mark Ambedkar’s 135th birth anniversary at Parliament House lawns on April 14
content: President Droupadi Murmu, Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, and other dignitaries will pay floral tributes to Dr. Ambedkar in a morning ceremony

title: 17 companies of CAPF deployed in Murshidabad, situation under control says DGP
content: BJP hits streets in protest against violence, Congress calls for all party meeting, Trinamool alleges spread of misinformation

title: India's iPhone, smartphone exports to U.S. have 20% tariff edge over China after exemption: Industry
content: The U.S. government amended its tariff order to exempt smartphones, tablets, laptops, and some other electronic devices from the new taxes.

title: VIT-AP University triumphs at Hackathon X semi-finals
content: Hackathon X semi-finals saw 150 participants battle it out in the CTF and Bug Bounty rounds; VIT-AP teams won top slots

title: TDP leaders warn Bhumana not to gain political mileage by hurting religious sentiments
content: Party’s polit bureau member and Sarvepalli MLA Somireddy Chandramohan Reddy warns the YSRCP leader not to play with the sentiments of devout Hindus, especially the ones of Tirumala

title: New film policy to be introduced soon, says Kandula Durgesh
content: Chief Minister and the Deputy Chief Minister committed to providing full support to the development of the film industry in the State, says Minister for Tourism, Culture and Cinematography

title: Kerala temple opens sanctum sanctorum to all communities for first time
content: Historic temple entry in Kerala marks end of caste restrictions, opening sanctums to all devotees permanently

title: Cooperative movement suffered due to policy inaction in past, were almost dead: Shah
content: As cooperation is a State subject under the Constitutional arrangement, initiatives were not taken by the erstwhile governments to frame cooperative laws adapting to rapidly changing conditions across the country, the Union Home Minister says. He credits the Modi government for reviving the sector by taking decisive actions.

title: Kerala would seek similar relief granted to Tamil Nadu in its case against acts of Governor Khan
content: Last week, the Supreme Court had ruled that the prolonged refusal of the Tamil Nadu Governor to give assent to the Bills passed by the Tamil Nadu Assembly was ‘illegal’ and ‘erroneous in law’

title: Inaugural India, Africa maritime engagement exercise begins in Tanzania
content: This initiative seeks to enhance interoperability and synergise combined operations among the maritime forces of partner nations, says Indian Navy

title: Massive protest erupts in Hyderabad against Waqf Act
content: The protest, which began at Lal Bahadur Shastri stadium at Basheerbagh and culminated at the Ambedkar Statue on Tank Bund, drew a large crowd from across the city

title: Tiruchi police launch weekend special operation at night to curb crime
content: Under the special drive, which will be on April 14, vehicles were searched at nine check posts and the police also visited the lodges; 16 cases of drinking and driving registered

title: DRDO tests directed energy weapon system that can disable drones, missiles
content: The success has put India in the exclusive and limited club of nations, which are possessing the high-power Laser-DEW system

title: Ahead of Nilambur bypoll, Anvar pushes for UDF entry
content: TMC State convener says his resignation as the LDF’s Independent legislator from the Nilambur created a conducive political situation for the UDF and the front should reciprocate and help turn the tide of public opinion against Pinarayism by making the TMC a constituent

title: 30 youth donate blood at Vizianagaram Youth Foundation’s camp
content: Blood donation camp helped address summer blood shortages in the city, colleges urged to hold similar camps

title: TTD rebuts YSRCP leader Karunakar Reddy’s allegations on cow deaths in the dairy farm
content: There is no negligence on the part of the TTD management or the staff, says the TTD Chairman B.R. Naidu

title: Rayachoti to get a facelift soon: Transport Minister
content: The constituency has witnessed visible change and development within 10 months under the coalition government, says Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy at a Praja Darbar event held at his residence in Boreddigaripalle village

title: Fishermen in Mallippattinam demand groyne structure after squall damages over 10 boats
content: Around 9 p.m. on Friday, strong winds lashed the coast, resulting in anchored boats colliding against one another, resulting in structural damage with one boat getting submerged

title: Combat hatred, ‘godi media’ and ‘WhatsApp university’ with love and truth, speakers urge public in Vijayawada
content: Supreme Court Advocate Prashant Bhushan emphasised the need for a committee in every district to ensure communal harmony, see that those spreading hatred are brought to book and promote camaraderie among people of different religions by celebrating all festivals

title: HAML distributes compensation worth ₹212 crore for 205  properties for Old City Metro route
content: The Old City road expansion works are being carried out at a fast pace and the metro rail construction too will begin as soon as approval from the Central government is received, HAML Managing Director said

title: Waqf Act a threat to minority rights: Wisdom Youth
content: The camp condemned the attempts of the Hindu right-wing groups, backed by the government, to wrest institutions and places of worship belonging to the minorities at different places across the country

title: 354 beneficiaries receive house titles in Mangalagiri, bringing to close first phase of Mana Illu–Mana Lokesh
content: The distribution of 354 land title documents in Mangalagiri concludes the first phase of the Mana Illu – Mana Lokesh housing program

title: Thiruvananthapuram Police crackdown on spas in anti-drug operation
content: In a major drug bust last week, Attingal police arrested three individuals, including a woman employee of a spa in Kazhakuttom for alleged possession of 52 grams of MDMA

title: Kerala becomes first State to achieve total digital literacy
content: Over 21 lakh people identified as ‘digitally illiterate’ taught to make voice and video calls using smartphones, access govt. services, to carry out Internet banking, and use social media platforms under the ‘Digi Kerala’ initiative of the Local Self-Government department

title: Chaityabhoomi, Deekshabhoomi ready to welcome lakhs on Ambedkar Jayanti
content: Chaityabhoomi in Mumbai’s Dadar, and Deekshabhoomi in Nagpur are significant landmarks in the life and legacy of the architect of the Indian Constitution

title: Controversy erupts in Kerala over denial of permission for Palm Sunday procession in Delhi
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan strongly criticised the Delhi Police’s decision to deny permission, calling the move a violation of Constitutional rights

title: HMWSSB not to penalise homes without RWH with double tanker charges for this season
content: The decision was taken in view of the prevailing high demand for water tankers in the season combined with the drying up of groundwater resource at several places in the city, said the Board Managing Director

title: Bharath accuses Bhumana of levelling baseless allegations on death of cows in goshala
content: YSRCP leader and TTD former Chairman Bhumana Karunakar Reddy recently alleged that the poor maintenance of the goshala by the NDA government had led to death of more than 100 cows in the past three months

title: Museums are knowledge centres that counter falsehoods with historical truths, says Kerala CM
content: He was inaugurating the Makreri Sree Subramanya Swamy Temple pilgrimage tourism initiative in Kannur as part of the Thalassery Heritage Tourism programme

title: Maranamass movie review: A few doses of ingenuity and a mix of idiosyncratic characters drive this film
content: Viral online content has now begun seeping into screenplays, to elicit easy applause. This “memeification” of screenplays is not necessarily a bad thing, especially in cases where it works like a charm

title: In the shadow of the Bodhi tree
content: The temple town of Bodh Gaya in Bihar, where people believe Buddha received enlightenment, is at the centre of a sensitive situation involving religion, politics and governance. Amarnath Tewary tracks how the Buddhist temple is administered under a 75-year-old law, and why people are protesting, many under the banner of the Bhim Army

title: As water tanker strike continues in Mumbai, BMC invokes Disaster Management Act to gain upper hand
content: BMC statement said a standard operating procedure (SOP) has formulated for streamlined water supply to private housing societies and other stakeholders

title: A project to transfer the knowledge of Kannadippaya making to future generations
content: The KFRI initiative, which aims at reviving the intricate art of Kannadippaya weaving, involves planting the raw material, procuring the harvested bamboo, and training the next generation of weavers

title: New Tirupati-Vontimitta temple tourism circuit soon
content: Devotees visiting Tirupati can explore Kanipakam, Srikalahasti, Gandikota, and more under TTD’s upcoming religious tourism circuit

title: Parliamentary panel recommends independent survey to assess MGNREGA
content: The 2023 recommendations of a government-appointed panel headed by former Rural Development Secretary Amarjeet Sinha to assess the gaps and inter-State variations in the scheme remains unimplemented

title: Pawars share stage twice in a week amid political divide
content: The senior Pawar and his nephew, now Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister, maintained a cordial demeanour at an event at Chhatrapati Shivaji College. A few days ago, Mr. Sharad Pawar had attended the engagement ceremony of Mr. Ajit Pawar’s younger son Jay Pawar near Pune.

title: BJP defends move to name training centre after Hedgewar
content: Party will take out  protest marches to the MLA office if attempts to defame Hedgewar continued, say BJP leaders

title: TDP will recognise services of those who work hard for party, says Bharath
content: The Industries and Commerce Minister was participating in a function organised at the Zilla Parishad office in Kurnool to felicitate B.T. Naidu, who was nominated as TDP MLC for the second time

title: Encouraged by swelling order book, BHEL is scouting for vendors to outsource manufacturing of components
content: Accprdomg to sources, the total value of orders received by BHEL for boilers to erect thermal power plants and others has crossed ₹1.80 lakh crore at the national-level

title: Heatwave alert in Telangana as temperatures soar beyond 43°C
content: Seven districts saw temperatures between 42°C and 43°C, while 16 districts recorded temperatures ranging from 40°C to 42°C

title: Joshi sees conspiracy in govt. not celebrating centenary of Ambedkar’s visit to Belagavi
content: If the centenary of Gandhi’s visit can be celebrated, why not that of Ambekdar’s? asks Pralhad Joshi

title: BJP working on agenda to make people fight over religion, caste: Rajasthan Congress’ Tikaram Jully
content: Mr. Jully, the Leader of Opposition in the Rajasthan Assembly, said Gyandev Ahuja was suspended from the BJP earlier too and was later reinstated

title: Vishu eve sparkles with lights, flavours, and festive cheer
content: Ready-made Sadyas are in hot demand this Vishu. Packed with a variety of curries, crispy papadams, and sweet payasams, these pre-packed feasts are flying off the shelves

title: BJP leader defends Eknath Shinde amid rumoured tensions in Maharashtra alliance
content: Sudhir Mungantiwar dismisses that there was any contentious discussion between Amit Shah and Eknath Shinde during Mr. Shah’s recent visit to the State

title: 'China admits to unleashing cyberattack 'Volt Typhoon' on US infra'
content: Chinese officials have admitted to conducting cyber attacks on US infrastructure, known as "Volt Typhoon," during a private meeting. This operation, linked to China's military, targeted critical sectors and maintained covert access to the US electric grid. The US also identified another campaign, "Salt Typhoon," targeting American telecommunications networks.

title: 'Correct mistakes': China calls on US to 'completely cancel' reciprocal tariffs
content: China urges the US to completely eliminate reciprocal tariffs imposed during the Trump administration, which have escalated to 145%. Describing the recent tariff exemption on consumer electronics as a "small step," China is assessing the overall impact. Businesses are increasingly concerned about the sustainability of US-China trade relations due to these escalating tensions and retaliatory levies.

title: Mayawati accepts nephew's public apology, re-inducts him in BSP
content: Mayawati has pardoned her nephew, Akash Anand, and reinstated him into the Bahujan Samaj Party after his public apology for prioritizing his father-in-law's influence over the party's interests. Akash pledged allegiance to Mayawati and vowed to avoid external influence in his political decisions. However, Mayawati has firmly rejected any possibility of reconciliation with Akash's father-in-law, citing his anti-party activities.

title: When Steve Jobs explained to Barack Obama why iPhones can’t be made in US
content: Amidst Trump's push for US manufacturing, Apple faces pressure to shift iPhone production domestically. Despite a commitment to invest in the US, Apple's past CEO, Steve Jobs, cited scale, speed, and specialized skills as reasons for manufacturing in China. To mitigate potential tariff impacts, Apple expedited iPhone shipments from India to China.

title: 'Dhoni isn't a soothsayer': Fleming on expecting instant CSK revival
content: Chennai Super Kings coach Stephen Fleming acknowledged the significant challenge of reviving their struggling IPL 2025 season. He clarified that MS Dhoni's return as captain won't magically solve their problems, especially after five consecutive defeats. Fleming emphasised the need for hard work and introspection within the squad, particularly after a disappointing loss to KKR.

title: Umpires stop play to check bats during RR vs RCB match
content: During an IPL match between Rajasthan Royals and Royal Challengers Bengaluru, umpire inspected Simron Hetmyer's bat for compliance with IPL regulations after his arrival at the crease. The inspection, conducted under Law 5.7, ensured the bat met specified dimensions. Hetmyer's bat passed, unlike a past incident where Essex faced a point deduction in the County Championship for a similar violation.

title: When LinkedIn co-founder said: Go home, have dinner, then open laptops...
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes a relentless work ethic is essential for startup success, even if it means sacrificing work-life balance. He suggests employees should continue working after family dinner, a stance he defends by highlighting the financial rewards for early employees. Hoffman argues that those prioritizing balance misunderstand the intense nature of the startup game.

title: Trump undergoes first medical exam since White House return: 5 key points
content: The White House announced President Trump is "fully fit" following his first medical check-up of his second term. The examination, conducted by Capt. Sean Barbabella, revealed a 20-pound weight loss since 2020 and improved cholesterol levels. While his blood pressure is slightly elevated at 128/74, his resting heart rate remains a healthy 62 beats per minute.

title: NIA grills Rana over Dawood Ibrahim link in 26/11 terror attack plot
content: The NIA is intensifying its investigation into Tahawwur Rana's role in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, scrutinizing his connections to a Dubai-based individual potentially linked to Dawood Ibrahim's D-Company. Investigators are analysing phone calls between Rana and Headley, exploring possible ISI and LeT ties, and examining Rana's pre-attack visits to India.

title: 'Say Jai Shri Ram': TN guv's message to students sparks fresh row
content: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi ignited controversy by urging students to chant "Jai Shri Ram" at a Madurai college event. Congress MLA JMH Hassan Maulaana strongly criticized Ravi, accusing him of promoting RSS and BJP ideologies and behaving like a religious leader rather than upholding the neutrality expected of his constitutional role.

title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy reveals the one question he still gets after 28 years
content: Amazon's CEO Andy Jassy emphasizes the critical role of persistent questioning, or "WhyQ," in the company's success. He believes this mindset, nurtured through practices like banning PowerPoint and drafting press releases early, helps deconstruct problems and unlock innovation.

title: Virat Kohli joins T20 elite, becomes first Indian to slam ...
content: Virat Kohli achieved a historic milestone, becoming the first Indian to score 100 half-centuries in T20 cricket during his unbeaten 62 against Rajasthan Royals. He now ranks second globally, only behind David Warner. Kohli's stellar performance, along with significant contributions from Phil Salt and Devdutt Padikkal, propelled RCB to a dominant nine-wicket victory.

title: ICC launches initiative to support displaced Afghan women cricketers
content: The ICC has launched a task force and support fund, in partnership with the BCCI, ECB and Cricket Australia, to aid displaced Afghan women cricketers. This initiative includes financial assistance and a high-performance program with elite coaching and facilities. The ICC also approved financial statements and announced key committee appointments, including re-appointments for Sourav Ganguly and Catherine Campbell.

title: Stephen Curry demands 'Game 7 mentality' as Golden State Warriors face with Los Angeles Clippers
content: Stephen Curry emphasizes the high stakes of the Golden State Warriors' final regular-season game against the Los Angeles Clippers, framing it as a 'Game 7' scenario. With both teams vying to avoid the Play-In Tournament, a win secures the Warriors a playoff berth and rest, while a loss could lead to a risky Play-In situation.

title: Khloe Kardashian goes nuclear on NBA exes; says "It's REALLY insulting to me!"
content: Khloe Kardashian confronts the expectation to forgive her exes, Tristan Thompson and Lamar Odom, for their infidelity. She expresses frustration with being perceived as a doormat and emphasizes the need to protect herself after repeated hurt. Khloe also reflects on a tense reunion with Odom, acknowledging she could have been gentler given their difficult history.

title: Man Who Kidnapped, Murdered Girl In Karnataka Killed In "Encounter"
content: A man who allegedly kidnapped and killed a five-year-old girl in Karnataka's Hubballi has been killed in an encounter with the police, officials said today. A policeman was injured during the operation, they said.

title: US Visa Bulletin For May 2025 Brings Bad News For Indians
content: Amid US President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown, the American dream of thousands of Indians seems to be fading.

title: 3 States, 700 CCTVs: Bengaluru Cops Arrest Sex Assault Accused In Kerala
content: A hunt to track and arrest a man accused of sexually harassing a woman in Bengaluru earlier this week has ended successfully, with cops scanning footage from 700 CCTVs and finally catching him in a remote village in Kerala.

title: Tamil Nadu Governor In Fresh Controversy Over "Jai Shri Ram" Slogan
content: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi, chastened by the Supreme Court for holding up 10 bills for over three years, has now landed in a fresh row, after allegedly asking students at a function to chant "Jai Shri Ram" at a function.

title: India's First Futuristic "Star Wars" Laser Weapon Shoots Down Drone Swarm
content: India has successfully tested a futuristic weapon for the first time by using high-powered laser-based directed energy to shoot down a drone.

title: How Bangladesh Barred Travel To Israel With A Passport Clause
content: Amid public anger against Israel's actions in the Gaza Strip in Bangladesh, the Muhammad Yunus-led interim government has barred its citizens from travelling to the Jewish state.

title: "Leave Now...": A 30-Day Warning For Foreign Nationals Staying In US
content: Foreign nationals who stay in the US longer than 30 days must register with the government and a failure to comply can lead to fines and imprisonment, the Department of Homeland Security under the Donald Trump administration has said.

title: IPL Live: 6,4,6 - Ignored India Star Thrashes Bumrah, Hits 50 In 22 Balls
content: Delhi Capitals vs Mumbai Indians LIVE Score, IPL 2025: Karun Nair and Abhishek Porel keep the scoreboard ticking for one-down Delhi Capitals

title: "Armed Gang Came From Nowhere": Locals On Bengal Violence Amid Waqf Stir
content: Skeletal remains of burnt vehicles, a looted shopping mall and a vandalised pharmacy were some of the tell-tale signs of violence that engulfed parts of Murshidabad district of West Bengal during protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act.

title: Tahawwur Rana Cited 33 Health Reasons To Stop Extradition. Then US Said This
content: Tahawwur Rana landed in Delhi on Thursday and has been sent to the custody of the anti-terror National Investigation Agency (NIA) for 18 days.

title: Rohit Fails Again As Dismal IPL Run Continues. Internet Says "Desperate..."
content: It was yet another disappointing outing for Mumbai Indians star batter Rohit Sharma as he was dismissed for 18 during the IPL 2025 encounter against Delhi Capitals.

title: Urge US To "Completely Cancel" Reciprocal Tariffs: China
content: China on Sunday called on the United States to "completely cancel" its reciprocal tariffs after Washington announced exemptions for consumer electronics and key chipmaking equipment.

title: Rajasthan Government  Appeals To Join Waqf Case In Supreme Court
content: The BJP government of Rajasthan has approached the Supreme Court, seeking to defend the Waqf Amendment law that has been challenged by many.

title: Donald Trump's Florida Golf Retreat Sparks Outcry Amid Escalating Tariff War
content: Financial markets around the world plummeted, wiping out trillions of dollars in value since Trump announced trade tariffs.

title: Doctor Assaulted After Woman Claims She Was Inappropriately Touched
content: A doctor has been assaulted in Karnataka's Vijayapura allegedly for inappropriately touching a woman during a scan.

title: How Insects, Smallest Animals Survive Antarctica
content: In Antarctica's freezing depths, tiny creatures have mastered survival tactics that could unlock secrets to extreme cold resistance, with implications for science and medicine.

title: IPL: Virat, Salt lead RCB's big win over RR in Jaipur
content: Phil Salt's explosive start and Virat Kohli's composed unbeaten innings powered Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a dominant nine-wicket victory over Rajasthan Royals. Chasing 174, RCB reached the target in 17.3 overs, with Salt's aggressive 65 and Kohli's 62* leading the charge. This win propelled RCB to third place in the IPL standings, while RR remained at seventh.

title: Watch: In a first, India uses laser weapon to shoot down aircraft, drones
content: India has achieved a significant milestone in defense technology with the successful demonstration of a 30-kilowatt laser weapon system capable of neutralizing aerial threats like drones and missiles. Developed by the DRDO, this directed-energy weapon is ready for production and deployment, placing India among a select group of nations with advanced laser capabilities.

title: Happy Rongali Bihu 2025: 50 Assamese New Year wishes, messages, and quotes to share
content: Rongali Bihu, the Assamese New Year, is a time for joy, prosperity, and new beginnings. The festival is celebrated with colorful festivities, traditional Bihu dance, and delicious feasts. Share heartwarming wishes and messages with loved ones to spread happiness and prosperity during this special occasion, ushering in a year filled with success and good health.

title: Bangladesh reintroduces 'except Israel' text in its passports
content: Bangladesh's interim government has reinstated the "except Israel" inscription on its passports, reversing a 2021 decision. This move, announced on Sunday, formally prohibits Bangladeshi citizens from traveling to Israel. The reintroduction coincides with widespread anger in Bangladesh over Israel's military actions in Gaza, as evidenced by recent large-scale protests in Dhaka.

title: Riyan Parag, with sunglasses on, drops Virat Kohli; fans fume
content: During the IPL 2025 match, Riyan Parag dropped a crucial catch of Virat Kohli, much to his own dismay and Sandeep Sharma's frustration. Yashasvi Jaiswal's impressive 75, supported by partnerships with Sanju Samson and Parag, propelled Rajasthan Royals to a total of 173 for 4. RCB chose to bowl first, with RR bringing in Wanindu Hasaranga.

title: Did Trump intentionally ignore Cheryl Hines at UFC 314? Watch video
content: At UFC 314 in Miami, Donald Trump seemingly snubbed Cheryl Hines, wife of Robert Kennedy Jr., shaking Kennedy's hand but bypassing her. Hines, who previously opposed Trump's candidacy, appeared frustrated but later greeted Trump's granddaughter. Kennedy chuckled at the interaction, while Hines had previously been seen engaging with Trump's supporters at Mar-a-Lago.

title: When will India get 5th-generation stealth fighter? DRDO chief answers
content: India is poised to receive its first fifth-generation stealth fighter jet, the AMCA, by 2035, as announced by DRDO chairman Samir V Kamat. DRDO is also planning to collaborate with a foreign OEM for aero-engine development. Furthermore, DRDO demonstrated its laser-based weapon system capable of neutralizing aerial threats, joining an elite group of nations with such capabilities.

title: Watch: Waqf law protesters clash with police in Assam's Silchar
content: In Silchar, Assam, a clash erupted on Sunday between police and demonstrators protesting the Waqf (Amendment) Act. Hundreds gathered in Berenga, blocking roads and allegedly throwing stones, prompting a baton charge by police to disperse the unauthorized protest.

title: After meet with Amit Shah, Shinde rebuffs rift within Mahayuti
content: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Eknath Shinde dismissed rumors of discord within the Mahayuti alliance, clarifying his meeting with Union Minister Amit Shah focused on state development projects. Speculation arose after appointments of guardian ministers and concerns over ministry files and reversed decisions. The BJP defended Shinde, stating he would address issues directly with Deputy CM Ajit Pawar.

title: 'Forced to drink alcohol, strangled': UP woman killed over property
content: In Etawah, police arrested two individuals for the murder of a woman who had invested in a property through one of the accused. When she requested her money back, the property dealer and his accomplice allegedly lured her, intoxicated her, and strangled her. The perpetrators disposed of the body in the Yamuna River and destroyed her scooter.

title: 'Do you have ties with Pak?': Punjab CM attacks Cong MLA over '50 bombs' remark
content: A controversy has erupted in Punjab after Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa claimed that 50 bombs had reached the state, with 18 already exploded. Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann demanded Bajwa reveal his source, questioning if he had ties to Pakistan.

title: Mother gets death sentence for 'ritual sacrifice' of 7-month-old baby
content: In a shocking verdict, a Suryapet court sentenced B Bharathi to death for the 2021 ritualistic murder of her infant daughter. Bharathi sacrificed her child to supposedly eliminate her 'sarpa dosham,' an astrological belief. This conviction was influenced by her prior imprisonment for assaulting her husband with a stone.

title: Pakistan Super League team announces powerful gesture for Palestine
content: Multan Sultans, a team in the Pakistan Super League, has launched a charitable campaign to support Palestinian charities. The team pledges to donate Rs 100,000 for every six hit and every wicket taken by their players during the PSL season. The league commenced with exciting matches, including Quetta Gladiators' victory and Karachi Kings' successful pursuit of Multan Sultans' score.

title: 8 dead, 7 injured in explosion at firecracker unit in Andhra Pradesh
content: A devastating explosion at a firecracker manufacturing unit in Anakapalle district's Kailasapatnam village has claimed the lives of eight individuals and left seven others injured. The incident occurred on Sunday afternoon, igniting a massive fire that engulfed the entire unit.

title: Milwaukee Bucks vs Detroit Pistons final injury report
content: Milwaukee Bucks will rest key players for the game against Detroit Pistons. Giannis Antetokounmpo is doubtful due to a shoulder issue. Damian Lillard and Brook Lopez are also out. The Bucks have already secured a playoff spot. The team wants to ensure players are healthy for the postseason. The game will give bench players a chance to play.

title: Kerala HC lawyer accused in rape case found hanging
content: Kerala High Court lawyer P G Manu, recently granted bail in an alleged rape case, was found dead in Kollam. Police suspect suicide at his rented accommodation after junior advocates discovered him. Manu, previously a senior government pleader and NIA counsel, faced accusations of sexually assaulting a client, leading to his resignation last year.

title: Bihar BJP files police complaint against Kanhaiya Kumar for remarks on PM Modi, RSS
content: The BJP's Bihar unit has lodged a police complaint against Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar in Patna, alleging he used offensive language against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the RSS during a recent television interview. The complaint, filed by a BJP delegation, seeks an FIR against Kumar for his remarks made on April 11, deeming them objectionable and unacceptable.

title: At least 32 killed as Russian missiles strike Ukraine; Zelenskyy shares video
content: A devastating Russian ballistic missile strike on Sumy, Ukraine, resulted in over 32 fatalities and 83 injuries, including children, on Palm Sunday. President Zelenskyy shared a horrific video of the aftermath, showing widespread destruction and casualties, and urgently appealed to the world for a firm response. The video showed several dead bodies and injured being rescued, cars engulfed in flames and the street littered with debris—shards of glass, pieces of concrete, and tree branches thrown by the explosion.

title: Vinesh Phogat hits out at 'Rs 2 tweeters': 'Zip it, sit in the corner... and cry'
content: Wrestler-turned-politician Vinesh Phogat, disqualified from the Paris Olympics, had accepted a Rs 4 crore cash prize from the Haryana government, equivalent to an Olympic silver medallist's benefits. Phogat, now a Congress MLA, chose the cash award over other options like a government job or land plot. She has hit out at social media trolls for

title: 'People rushed out of buildings': Witnesses on fresh Myanmar quake
content: A 5.5 magnitude earthquake struck central Myanmar early Sunday, causing residents to flee their homes near the epicenter. This tremor follows a devastating 7.7-magnitude earthquake on March 28, which killed thousands and exacerbated the country's humanitarian crisis. The recent quake shook buildings and damaged ceilings, adding to the challenges faced by a nation already grappling with conflict and displacement.

title: IPL: Why are RCB wearing green jersey against Rajasthan Royals?
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru played Rajasthan Royals wearing green jerseys. This promoted environmental sustainability. Rajat Patidar chose to bowl first after winning the toss. The green kit is part of RCB's "Go Green" initiative. It raises awareness about conservation. The jersey is made from recycled polyester. RCB is a carbon-neutral franchise. They monitor emissions from various sources.

title: Hardik Pandya's priceless '1100g gift' to young cricketer
content: Hardik Pandya fulfilled his promise to Kashvee Gautam, gifting her a customized bat weighing 1100 grams. He presented the bat before Mumbai Indians' clash against Delhi Capitals, congratulating her on her first call-up to the Indian team following a stellar WPL season with Gujarat Giants. Pandya encouraged her to play well and represent India.

title: Shardul hits back at commentators: 'It's easy to sit and comment'
content: Shardul Thakur has defended bowlers against criticism from commentators, emphasising the increasing prevalence of high scores in modern cricket. He highlighted the team's successful defense of scores despite missing key players, attributing their success to nerve and belief. Thakur also suggested commentators should review their own records before criticising players.

title: Wetzel: House settlement officially ends college amateurism, and good riddance
content: amateurism, at least in college athletics, is a good settlement . it will soon open the door for college athletic departments to pay athletes directly with revenue gleaned from media rights, tickets, sponsorships and so on . many think it's what many think should have happened generations ago . this would be official death certificate, though .

title: UFC 314 takeaways: Volkanovski is back, Pimblett shines -- again
content: Alexander Volkanovski defeated Diego Lopes by unanimous decision to win the featherweight championship . yair Rodriguez revived his career with an impressive performance to ruin Patricio Pitbull's debut . "Old Man Volk" is champion once again but the division is a lot different than the one he reigned over .

title: Stanley Cup playoff watch: What's at stake in Sunday's games
content: the 11 NHL games on Saturday helped solidify the playoff picture . three teams (the Detroit Red Wings , New York Rangers and New York Islanders) have been eliminated from the race . in the west, the St. Louis Blues kept hope alive for the Calgary Flames . the Winnipeg Jets and Vegas Golden Knights won their games to win division titles .

title: Jon Rahm's purple pants headline Masters fashion
content: mullet and all have some unique fashion in Georgia this week . some of the most popular sporting events in the world have been in the u.s. in 2025 . there's a lot of different styles to choose from in the past .

title: WNBA DraftCast: Ranking the top 50 prospects for 2025
content: PG C She's a skilled 6-7 center, but some GMs have expressed doubt about drafting Sedona Prince . the no. 2 pick sees an international entry, while Hailey Van Lith, sedona prince drop out of the first round .
